annotations.description: Application template for a router and monitoring console in a production environment, for Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.13 - Deprecated
annotations.openshift.io/display-name: Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.13 production monitoring environment
annotations.template.openshift.io/long-description: This template defines resources needed for a router and monitoring console in a production environment for Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.13, including application deployment configuration, secure and insecure http communication and persistent volume to store data that needs to survive to a restart. Template for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform version 3.11. Deprecated since Red Hat Process Automation Manager version 7.5; consider using the Red Hat Business Automation Operator.

message:
A new environment has been set up for Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.
The username/password needed for accessing the application are stored in "${CREDENTIALS_SECRET}" secret as
KIE_ADMIN_USER and KIE_ADMIN_PWD

You must create the secret named "${CREDENTIALS_SECRET}" containing the KIE_ADMIN_USER and KIE_ADMIN_PWD values and
the secret named "${KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_HTTPS_SECRET}" and ${BUSINESS_CENTRAL_HTTPS_SECRET} containing the
${BUSINESS_CENTRAL_HTTPS_KEYSTORE} and ${KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_HTTPS_KEYSTORE} files used for serving secure content.

parameters.name: APPLICATION_NAME
parameters.description: The name for the application.

parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_ID
parameters.description: The id to use for the maven repository, if set. Default is generated randomly.

parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_URL
parameters.description: Fully qualified URL to a Maven repository or service.

parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_USERNAME
parameters.description: User name for accessing the Maven repository, if required.

parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_PASSWORD
parameters.description: Password to access the Maven repository, if required.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_SERVICE
parameters.displayName: Name of the Business Central service
parameters.description: The Service name for the optional Business Central, where it can be reached, to allow service lookups (for example,  maven repo usage), if required.

parameters.name: CREDENTIALS_SECRET
parameters.description: Secret containing the KIE_ADMIN_USER and KIE_ADMIN_PWD values

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_CONTROLLER_OPENSHIFT_GLOBAL_DISCOVERY_ENABLED
parameters.description: If set to true, turns on KIE Server global discovery feature (Sets the org.kie.server.controller.openshift.global.discovery.enabled system property)

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_CONTROLLER_OPENSHIFT_PREFER_KIESERVER_SERVICE
parameters.description: If OpenShift integration of Business Central is turned on, setting this parameter to true enables connection to KIE Server via an OpenShift internal Service endpoint. (Sets the org.kie.server.controller.openshift.prefer.kieserver.service system property)

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_CONTROLLER_TEMPLATE_CACHE_TTL
parameters.description: KIE ServerTemplate Cache TTL in milliseconds (Sets the org.kie.server.controller.template.cache.ttl system property)

parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_NAMESPACE
parameters.description: Namespace in which the ImageStreams for Red Hat Process Automation Manager images are installed. These ImageStreams are normally installed in the openshift namespace. You need to modify this parameter only if you installed the ImageStream in a different namespace/project. Default is "openshift".

parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_TAG
parameters.description: A named pointer to an image in an image stream. Default is "7.13.0".

parameters.name: SMART_ROUTER_HOSTNAME_HTTP
parameters.displayName: Smart Router Custom http Route Hostname
parameters.description: Custom hostname for http service route.  Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: insecure-<application-name>-smartrouter-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>

parameters.name: SMART_ROUTER_HOSTNAME_HTTPS
parameters.displayName: Smart Router Custom https Route Hostname
parameters.description: Custom hostname for https service route. Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: <application-name>-smartrouter-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_ID
parameters.description: Router ID used in API communication. (Router property org.kie.server.router.id)

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_PROTOCOL
parameters.description: KIE Server router protocol. (Used to build the org.kie.server.router.url.external property)

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_URL_EXTERNAL
parameters.description: Public URL where the router can be found. Format http://<host>:<port> (Router property org.kie.server.router.url.external)

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_NAME
parameters.description: Router name used in the Business Central user interface. (Router property org.kie.server.router.name)

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_HTTPS_SECRET
parameters.description: The name of the secret containing the keystore file.

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_HTTPS_KEYSTORE
parameters.description: The name of the keystore file within the secret.

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_HTTPS_NAME
parameters.description: The name associated with the server certificate.

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ROUTER_HTTPS_PASSWORD
parameters.description: The password for the keystore and certificate.

parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_MONITOR_TOKEN
parameters.description: KIE Server monitor token for bearer authentication. (Sets the org.kie.server.controller.token system property)

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_HOSTNAME_HTTP
parameters.displayName: Business Central Custom http Route Hostname
parameters.description: Custom hostname for http service route.  Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: insecure-<application-name>-rhpamcentrmon-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_HOSTNAME_HTTPS
parameters.displayName: Business Central Custom https Route Hostname
parameters.description: Custom hostname for https service route. Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: <application-name>-rhpamcentrmon-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_HTTPS_SECRET
parameters.displayName: Business Central Server Keystore Secret Name
parameters.description: The name of the secret containing the keystore file.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_HTTPS_KEYSTORE
parameters.description: The name of the keystore file within the secret.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_HTTPS_NAME
parameters.description: The name associated with the server certificate.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_HTTPS_PASSWORD
parameters.description: The password for the keystore and certificate.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_MEMORY_LIMIT
parameters.description: Business Central Container memory limit.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_MEMORY_REQUEST
parameters.description: Business Central Container memory request.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_CPU_LIMIT
parameters.description: Business Central Container CPU limit.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_CPU_REQUEST
parameters.description: Business Central Container CPU request.

parameters.name: SMART_ROUTER_MEMORY_LIMIT
parameters.description: Smart Router Container memory limit.

parameters.name: SSO_URL
parameters.description: RH-SSO URL.

parameters.name: SSO_REALM
parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm name.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_SSO_CLIENT
parameters.displayName: Business Central Monitoring RH-SSO Client name
parameters.description: Business Central Monitoring RH-SSO Client name.

parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_SSO_SECRET
parameters.displayName: Business Central Monitoring RH-SSO Client Secret
parameters.description: Business Central Monitoring RH-SSO Client Secret.

parameters.name: SSO_USERNAME
parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm admin user name for creating the Client if it doesn't exist.

parameters.name: SSO_PASSWORD
parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm Admin Password used to create the Client.

parameters.name: SSO_DISABLE_SSL_CERTIFICATE_VALIDATION
parameters.description: RH-SSO Disable SSL Certificate Validation.

parameters.name: SSO_PRINCIPAL_ATTRIBUTE

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_URL
parameters.description: LDAP endpoint to connect for authentication. For failover, set two or more LDAP endpoints separated by space.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_LOGIN_MODULE
parameters.description: LDAP login module flag, adds backward compatibility with the legacy security subsystem on Elytron. 'optional' is the only supported value, if set, it will create a distributed realm on Elytron configuration with LDAP and FileSystem realms with the user added using the KIE_ADMIN_USER.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_LOGIN_FAILOVER
parameters.description: Enable failover, if LDAP Url is unreachable, it will fail over to the KieFsRealm.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN
parameters.description: Bind DN used for authentication.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BIND_CREDENTIAL
parameters.description: LDAP Credentials used for authentication.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORDS
parameters.description: Does this realm support blank password direct verification? Blank password attempt will be rejected otherwise. Boolean flag, defaults to false.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BASE_CTX_DN
parameters.description: LDAP Base DN of the top-level context to begin the user search.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BASE_FILTER
parameters.description: LDAP search filter used to locate the context of the user to authenticate. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. A common example for the search filter is (uid={0}).

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_RECURSIVE_SEARCH
parameters.description: Indicates if the user queries are recursive.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_SEARCH_TIME_LIMIT
parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds for user or role searches.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_ID
parameters.description: Name of the attribute containing the user roles.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLES_CTX_DN
parameters.description: The fixed DN of the context to search for user roles. This is not the DN where the actual roles are, but the DN where the objects containing the user roles are. For example, in a Microsoft Active Directory server, this is the DN where the user account is.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_FILTER
parameters.description: A search filter used to locate the roles associated with the authenticated user. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. The authenticated userDN is substituted into the filter anywhere a {1} is used. An example search filter that matches on the input username is (member={0}). An alternative that matches on the authenticated userDN is (member={1}).

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_RECURSION
parameters.description: The number of levels of recursion the role search will go below a matching context. Disable recursion by setting this to 0.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_DEFAULT_ROLE
parameters.description: A role included for all authenticated users.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_NEW_IDENTITY_ATTRIBUTES
parameters.description: Provide new identities for LDAP  identity mapping, the pattern to be used with this env is 'attribute_name=attribute_value;another_attribute_name=value'

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_REFERRAL_MODE
parameters.description: If LDAP referrals should be followed. Corresponds to REFERRAL ('java.naming.referral') environment property. Allowed values: 'ignore', 'follow', 'throw'

parameters.name: AUTH_ROLE_MAPPER_ROLES_PROPERTIES
parameters.displayName: Role Mapping roles properties file path or one lined roles
parameters.description: When present, the RoleMapping will be configured to use the provided properties file or roles. This parameter defines the fully-qualified file path and name of a properties file or a set of roles with the following pattern 'role=role1;another-role=role2'. The format of every entry in the file is original_role=role1,role2,role3

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_MAPPER_KEEP_MAPPED
parameters.description: When set to 'true' the mapped roles will retain all roles, that have defined mappings.

parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_MAPPER_KEEP_NON_MAPPED
parameters.description: When set to 'true' the mapped roles will retain all roles, that have no defined mappings.
